ygData.subject: Re: kos
ygData.msgSnippet: I was never KOS in Kaladim as a barbarian so I never saw any faction adjustments change at the chessboard. However I have seen changes to my faction with the
ygData.messageBody:
I was never KOS in Kaladim as a barbarian so I never saw any faction adjustments change at the chessboard.
However I have seen changes to my faction with the Stormguard change from the follwing mobs: Aviak chicks and
elders, Crushbone Orcs, and the goblins in butcherblock. Last night I noticed I went from dubious to amiable
with the dwarves and the only thing I really killed repeatedly was the goblins. The only faction that got
worse was the Runnyeye. So you might want to try them.

Daniel Robinson wrote:

> From: "Daniel Robinson" <danielr@...>
>
> Hit the chess board in Butcher. You will gain faction with the guards there, but only up to dubiliousy.
>
> >>> James Schuldes <jgs@...> 06/29 7:46 AM >>>
> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
> Can't you get someone to make you invisible so you can slip past them?
> Sounds like they don't like your religion? Sorry I cant give you more help
> - just guessing.
>
> Snyak.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Linda McClellan [mailto:lindamc97@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, June 29, 1999 7:39 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: [warriors_eq] kos
>
> From: Linda McClellan <lindamc97@...>
>
> I am a lvl 24 woodelf warrior. Beginning to think I'm the
> only woodelf
> warrior :) I have been kos since the beginning by the Darven
> City Guards.
> After oh 12-15 kills I left, made my way to Freeport and
> other places to do
> my levelling. I have swam around to get to unrest but some
> named npc still
> found me by dags cauldron and whacked me. I now WANT to go
> home. I want to
> go to mistmoore. Is it something I said, did, didn't do?
> They always say
> something like I'm not a believer?? Of What? Can I raise
> factions? How?
> Really sorry for all the questions but I want to go to my
> homeland and can
> not, safely anyway. I'm a woodelf for crying out loud, not a
> dark race.
> Any and all help is greatly appreciated.
>
> Tan the homeless woodelf.
>
